image.altText: Festival-goers at a music festival in Sydney.

props.synopsis: It is one of the big challenges of parenting; setting rules around alcohol with teenagers. Is it a good idea to give them a taste early? Is that even legal?

title.children: Can you give your underage teenager alcohol legally? This and other questions about youth drinking answered

image.altText: An older woman with a dark grey bob and glasses speaks into a small microphone in front of a blue screen.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank has kept rates steady at 4.35 per cent for another six weeks, amid a dramatic spike in volatility in financial and stock markets.

title.children: Reserve Bank keeps interest rates on hold at 4.35 per cent

image.altText: Joint sitting thumbnail

props.synopsis: The dismissal of the Whitlam government in 1975 has long overshadowed another monumental event in Australian political history from that era.

title.children: It's 50 years since Whitlam used a political 'last resort' that changed Australia

image.altText: A young woman in a green jacket covers her face while walking down a ramp with silver handrails alongside a young man.

props.synopsis: A young worker who fell asleep and crashed a ute pulling an overloaded horse float after a long day tending to the animals is given a suspended jail term over the 2023 incident which injured her co-workers.

title.children: Former Yole harness racing worker gets suspended jail term over 2023 horse float crash

image.altText: A multi-storey building higher than other buildings in a commercial area of a CBD.

props.synopsis: After being knocked back in May, a social housing development for vulnerable older women has the backing of Hobart City Council after the proponent slashed its assessment of how much extra traffic the building would generate.

title.children: Hobart apartments for vulnerable women a step closer after earlier knockback

image.altText: ASX 200 board

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank of Australia has left interest rates on hold at 4.35 per cent in its sixth-straight meeting. Meanwhile, the ASX is trading higher in the afternoon's trade. Follow live.

title.children: Michelle Bullock effectively rules out cut in the 'near term' after leaving interest rates on hold

image.altText: Nicolaas Bester, Grace Tame's childhood abuser, leaves court in Hobart.

props.synopsis: Nicolaas Ockert Bester was charged with a cybercrime of "menacing" former Australian of the Year Grace Tame on social media but says he is unfit to stand trial due to dementia.

title.children: Grace Tame's schoolteacher abuser argues he has dementia and can't stand trial for alleged social media harassment

image.altText: Copy of 5qh11

props.synopsis: Tom Brady watches Simone Biles in action, a Paraguay swimmer is asked to leave the village over a Disneyland trip, and heartbreak in the gymnastics. Here are some moments you may have missed overnight in Paris.

title.children: Olympic quick hits: Swimmer leaves village over Disneyland trip and Comaneci hits out after heartbreaking gymnastics moment

image.altText: A woman in a veil walks past armed men carrying bayonets

props.synopsis: As she flew to neighbouring India, thousands of protesters stormed Sheikh Hasina's official residence, some lying on a bed, another munching on chicken leg pieces and others trying on her clothes. Here's how the longest-serving female head of state was toppled.

title.children: Bangladesh's 'Iron Lady', the longest-serving female head of government in the world, just fled on a chopper

image.altText: A person voting at a booth in the ACT election

props.synopsis: Booming Chinese and South Asian migrant communities are keen to engage in Australian democracy but many do not fully understand how politics works in their adopted home country, new research has shown.

title.children: 'Set up by white Englishmen, for white Englishmen': Why Australia's political system is inaccessible for many migrants

image.altText: Jess Fox hugs Noemie Fox's face from in the water

props.synopsis: Fox sisters sweep the canoe slalom medals in Vaires-sur-Marne, with Noémie stepping out of Jess's enormous shadow to claim a joyful gold medal.

title.children: Jess Fox leapt into the water to salute her sister Noémie, so often in the shadow, now with a golden lustre all of her own

image.altText: Police detain a female protester on the ground

props.synopsis: Other countries also issue travel alerts for the United Kingdom as the British PM announces a special police force to deal with the violence.

title.children: Travel alert for Australians visiting UK amid ongoing riots after Southport stabbing attack

image.altText: Anthony Albanese looks sternly off to the distance.

props.synopsis: Iran's ambassador to Australia is confronted over remarks calling for "wiping out the Zionist plague", amid fears Iran may soon retaliate to the assassination of one of terror group Hamas' political leaders.

title.children: Iran's ambassador 'called in' over tweet about removing Israelis from Palestinian 'holy lands'

image.altText: Two people stand and take questions from waiting media outside a court building

props.synopsis: Posts on social media, including an Instagram story uploaded on Monday by Brittany Higgins, have triggered Linda Reynolds' lawyer to claim there was a "co-ordinated plan" afoot to mislead the public during their high-profile defamation trial.

title.children: Brittany Higgins Instagram post during defamation trial draws ire of Linda Reynolds lawyer

image.altText: A group of three Olympic medals - with silver, gold and bronze left to right - are shown against a dark background.

props.synopsis: Keep up with how many medals Aussie athletes have won today — and where Australia sits on the leaderboard.

title.children: Here's the medal standings after day 10 of the Olympic Games

image.altText: Australian Olympic diver Melissa Wu in mid-air in the tuck position with yellow and white circle graphics around her.

props.synopsis: As two Aussies head into the 10m diving finals, put your armchair critic skills to the test and see whether you can match our Olympic judge.

title.children: Melissa hits the water at 60kph — can you judge whether she nails a dive?

image.altText: Australian Opposition Leader Peter Dutton

props.synopsis: The federal opposition leader said it would be a "disaster" if the government were returned in a minority due, in part, to "Muslim candidates from Western Sydney".

title.children: 'Reinforcing harmful stereotypes': Religious vilification complaint lodged against Peter Dutton

image.altText: A composite image showing Dustin Martin in his first and last games of his AFL career.

props.synopsis: Dustin Martin may have worn number four on his back the majority of his career, but it's a different figure that separates him from the rest.

title.children: Cracking the code that is the enigma and brilliance of Tigers star Dustin Martin

image.altText: tom pritcard army

props.synopsis: He was the last direct link with the 14,000 Australian servicemen who held the Libyan port of Tobruk against the German Africa Corps in 1941, a vital battle for the Allied forces.

title.children: Australia's last Rat of Tobruk Tom Pritchard dies aged 102

image.altText: Four men in black and white against a blue gradient background

props.synopsis: Once decided, her VP pick will join her on a tour of multiple battleground states across the US ahead of the Democratic National Convention.

title.children: Kamala Harris is just days away from a battleground tour with her vice-president pick. Here's who's still in the running

image.altText: A woman in a wide-brimmed hat sits on a deckchair on a sandy beach, watching the ocean.

props.synopsis: Paid long service leave remains an entrenched Australian value and serves to reward long-serving employees, including casual and part-time workers, by providing them with an extended period of additional paid time-off. But what exactly are your entitlements?

title.children: Are you entitled to long service leave and how do you access it?

image.altText: An aerial shot of the Al-Assad airbase.

props.synopsis: Two Katyusha rockets are fired at Iraq's al-Asad air base, injuring US personnel as tensions rise in the Middle East.

title.children: Rockets fired at Iraq's al-Asad air base, injuring US personnel

image.altText: A white hurricane cloud cluster with a long tail is seen from space over a blue-green ocean with the US visible underneath

props.synopsis: The weather system continued to batter coastal regions with flooding and high winds as it was downgraded on Monday to a tropical storm.

title.children: Hurricane Debby makes landfall as US south flooded — warning of 'once in a thousand year' rain event

image.altText: On a purple background a woman in greyscale wears a read helmet and boxing gloves. Beside her a figure in red and 1 in blue box

props.synopsis: What started as athletes attempting to compete in their chosen sport has spiralled into a story that now involves a Russia-linked official, a global social media pile-on, huge amounts of mis- and disinformation and anti-trans activists jumping in.

title.children: What's behind a global social media pile-on in Olympic women's boxing

image.altText: Five men from band The Red Clay Strays stand side by side in a rural field

props.synopsis: With hundreds of millions of streams and a spot on the massive Twisters soundtrack, The Red Clay Strays are ready to take their authentic, soulful country music to the world.

title.children: 'I don't think we're country': Even so, The Red Clay Strays are part of the genre's monumental ascent

image.altText: RBA reno 2

props.synopsis: What a difference a week can make. Just days ago, there were growing calls for the RBA to hike rates once more. Now that's effectively off the table, financial markets are in a mad panic that rate cuts won't come soon enough.

title.children: The RBA has managed to dodge a bullet on interest rates, but dark economic clouds are looming

image.altText: A woman in an NT police uniform standing in a crowd and wiping a tear from her eye.

props.synopsis: The NT police apology to Aboriginal people comes during a year of heightened tensions across the jurisdiction. Some hope it could be a first step towards healing.

title.children: A police officer's tears show the power of saying sorry. But will it heal a troubled territory?

image.altText: View of a palm tree-lined road with a yellow middle strip in California leading into the horizon.

props.synopsis: California, known for palm tree-lined boulevards and the iconic Hollywood hills, is adding another claim to fame: renewable energy. And the Golden State could offer a glimpse into the crystal ball of Australia's energy future.

title.children: In California, big batteries are eating into gas demand, showing how Australia could harness its solar power glut

image.altText: a crocodile in murky water

props.synopsis: David Hogbin, 40, disappeared after falling into the Annan River on Saturday. He was with family members when the incident occurred.

title.children: Newcastle doctor named as Far North Queensland croc attack victim

image.altText: GPS tracker on an ankle with person wearing a black shoe.

props.synopsis: In a case largely of its own making, the High Court will today be asked to rule on whether a law requiring those freed from indefinite immigration detention last year to wear ankle bracelets and live under a curfew, is valid.

title.children: High Court to rule on legality of curfew and ankle bracelets for those freed from indefinite immigration detention

image.altText: Penny Wong speaks at a podium in front of Australian and US flags.

props.synopsis: Australians will soon be eligible for easier passage through American airports as participation in the US Global Entry program is set to begin early next year.

title.children: Australia, US strike deal to save travellers time at American airports

image.altText: A man in military fatigues holds a photo of a man

props.synopsis: Police say the pilot was killed when separatist rebels rounded up those on board the helicopter when it landed in an isolated area.

title.children: NZ helicopter pilot killed in Indonesia's Papua region named as Glen Malcolm Conning

image.altText: Tom Hawkins poses with his family

props.synopsis: Cats legend Tom Hawkins will retire at the end of the AFL season, drawing an end to a career that includes three premierships and at least 359 games — the most of any Geelong player.

title.children: 'It's been a hell of a ride': Geelong games-record holder Tom Hawkins announces retirement

image.altText: Nick looking at son

props.synopsis: A proposal for a tiered approach to NDIS provider registration based on risk has been cautiously welcomed by a number of disability advocates.

title.children: 'We should decide who touches our bodies': Attention turns to the next phase of complex NDIS reform
